articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched several waves of missile and drone attacks overnight targeting Kyiv and other regions, Ukraine's military said early on Tuesday, a day after Moscow's biggest such attack of the war.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with missiles, drones for second day in row, Kyiv says

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday that the war with Russia would eventually end in dialogue, but that Kyiv had to be in a strong position and that he would present a plan to U.S. President Joe Biden and his two potential successors.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to present plan to Biden to end war with Russia

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians displaced by fighting in the Gaza Strip crowded onto the seashore as Israeli forces continued to battle Hamas fighters in central and southern areas, with health officials reporting at least 17 people killed in strikes on Tuesday.
articles.title: Israel battles Hamas in Gaza as space for displaced families narrows

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby, Julie Steenhuysen
articles.description: Scientists studying the new mpox strain that has spread out of Democratic Republic of Congo say the virus is changing faster than expected and often in areas where experts lack the funding and equipment to properly track it.
articles.title: New mpox strain is changing fast; African scientists are ‘working blindly’ to respond

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The captain of the luxury yacht owned by the family of British tech magnate Mike Lynch that sank off Sicily last week declined to respond to prosecutors during questioning on Tuesday, one of his lawyers said.
articles.title: Captain of sunken Lynch family yacht declines to answer investigators' questions

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: Russia said the West was playing with fire by considering allowing Ukraine to strike deep into Russia with Western missiles and cautioned the United States on Tuesday that World War Three would not be confined to Europe.
articles.title: Russia warns the United States of the risks of World War Three

articles.author: Vivian Sequera
articles.description: Peaceful street protests and international pressure still have the potential to unseat Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said on Tuesday, as an election dispute reaches the one-month mark and the opposition's pathways to claim power seemingly narrow.
articles.title: Venezuela's Machado says peaceful protests, external pressure could still oust Maduro

articles.author: Jose Luis Gonzalez
articles.description: In the northern Mexican state of Chihuahua, residents and farmers have anxiously watched and waited for clouds to bring rain to refill dried-out dams, water wells and lagoons. They've waited so far in vain.
articles.title: 'Nature is punishing us': Drought imperils farmers and bees in Mexico's north

articles.author: Gabriel Araujo
articles.description: Brazil's lower house of Congress was set on Tuesday to install a committee to monitor investigations into an aircraft crash in Sao Paulo state earlier this month, in which all 62 passengers and crew were killed.
articles.title: Brazilian Congress to install committee on Voepass crash investigation

articles.author: Corina Pons, Borja Suarez
articles.description: On the rugby field as well as on the streets of the Spanish island of Tenerife, Moussa Diaby Wage is one of thousands of migrants from Mali seeking a better future in Europe.
articles.title: Malian migrant takes to rugby field, chasing brighter future in Spain
